alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 17 at 7:16PM MDT until May 17 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... At 715 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles east of Kit Carson, or 14 miles southwest of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 142. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
